Name: El Coco
Ingredients: 60 ml Light white rum (charcoal-filtered 1-4 years old)
5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of lime zest twist.
Express lime zest twist over the cocktail and use as garnish.
Review: Rum and coconut water with the merest hint of lime.
History: Created in 2008 by Richard Hunt at Mahiki in London, England and named after the coconut palm outside the original Bacardi distillery in Santiago de Cuba.
Nutrition: One serving of El Coco contains 147 calories
